main.name: Category
main.description: A `Category` represents a type of objects in the Game, e.g. the terrain or backgrounds in a sidescroller game.

children.name: Object
children.description: Return a new object/instance of the Category. e.g.: in sidescroller game, in the `Terrain` category, `Terrain.Object(options)` would return a new block in the terrain.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: The options for the new object. For example: position, lethal, width/height, etc. No arguments: return a default object.

children.name: Init
children.description: Init the Category. Not required, but probably used, as this is also the place where this Category's part of the current Scene will end up.

arguments.name: objects
arguments.description: The objects from this Category's part of the current Scene.

children.name: Update
children.description: Update this Category and its objects.

children.name: Draw
children.description: Draw the objects of this Category to the canvas.

arguments.name: game
arguments.description: The Game object. `Game.context` contains the canvas context, `Game.draw` is a Draw object that's meant to be reused through all draws.
